intro: Euplassa glaziovii, commonly known as Glaziov's euplassa, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, hot climates. Euplassa glaziovii is often found in rocky or limestone areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
